snippet.desc: A button to switch to a different scene.
snippet.description: A button to switch to a different scene.
snippet.name: Switch Scene Button

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _HoverAnimation

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the switch scene transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

control.desc: Select the key used for jumping.
control.name: _JumpKey

number.desc:
When releasing the jump key before reaching the max
height, what is the rate of upward slowdown?

default = 0.75
number.name: _JumpingSlowdown

number.desc:
Amount of force applied when jumping.
Default = 35
number.name: _JumpForce

number.desc:
Maximum amount of time that the
jump force will be applied when holding down the jump button.

default = 0.075
number.name: _MaxJumpTime

snippet.desc: Allows the actor to run and jump while on the ground.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to run and jump while on the ground.
snippet.name: Jump and Run Movement

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events. Trigger the events MoveLeft, MoveRight, or Jump to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The maximum speed at which the actor can run.
number.name: _MaximumRunningSpeed

number.desc: The force used for jumping.
number.name: _JumpingForce

boolean.desc: If selected, use the <var>Jump</var> animations while falling, otherwise use the <var>Idle</var> animations.
boolean.name: _JumpAnimationWhenFalling

boolean.desc: If selected, the jumping height will depend on how long the <var>Jump</var> key is pressed.
boolean.name: _VariableJump

number.desc: Holding down the jump key longer than this will not make the actor jump higher. Only used if <var>Variable Jump</var> is selected.
number.name: _VariableJumpDuration

number.desc: The force used for running.
number.name: _RunningForce

snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move left and right.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move left and right.
snippet.name: 2 Way Horizontal Movement

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events. Trigger the events MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to move vertically.
boolean.name: _PreventVerticalMovement

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurning

snippet.desc: This is the most basic run and jump behavior possible. We created this together in Fraser Beginning Video Game Creation Class. If you are not in this class, their are MUCH better (organized, functional and documented) behaviors out there.
snippet.description: This is the most basic run and jump behavior possible. We created this together in Fraser Beginning Video Game Creation Class. If you are not in this class, their are MUCH better (organized, functional and documented) behaviors out there.
snippet.name: Fraser Class Simple Run and Jump

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make the camera follow it. You can then specify the speed at which the camera should "scroll" towards the actor.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make the camera follow it. You can then specify the speed at which the camera should "scroll" towards the actor.
snippet.name: Camera Follow

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The x-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The y-position that the camera should be.
number.name: _intendedCameraY

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current x-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraX

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE: The current y-position of the camera.
number.name: _currentCameraY

number.desc: The speed, in pixels per frame, that the camera should scroll by following the actor. Leave as 0 to indicate an instant jump.
number.name: _ScrollSpeed

snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right.
snippet.name: 4 Way Movement

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurning

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will stop moving if diagonal keys are pressed at the same.
If unselected, the actor will move in the direction of the most recently pressed key.
boolean.name: _DiagonalStop

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events.
Trigger the events MoveUp, MoveDown, MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

snippet.desc: Loop music when the scene is loaded.
snippet.description: Loop music when the scene is loaded.
snippet.name: Background Music

number.desc: The channel at which to play the music. Must be between 0 and 31 inclusive.
number.name: _Channel

boolean.desc: If selected, the sound on the selected channel will be stopped before the music starts.
boolean.name: _StopChannelFirst

snippet.desc:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.description:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.name: Cannot Exit Scene

snippet.desc: Makes the actor bounce off the screen bounds as if they where solid.
snippet.description: Makes the actor bounce off the screen bounds as if they where solid.
snippet.name: Bounce Off Screen Bounds

number.desc:
A factor determining the speed of the actor after it hits the screen bounds.
Must be a value between 0 and 1. A bounciness of 1 will make the actor bounce off with the same speed. A bounciness of 0 will make the actor not bounce at all.
number.name: _Bounciness

snippet.desc: Shows an intro title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.description: Shows an intro title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.name: Intro Title

boolean.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. Whether or not the slide-off has started.
boolean.name: _Started

font.desc: The font to use when drawing the intro title. Specify from the list of fonts you have created in Stencyl.
font.name: _FontToUse

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, before that the intro title should wait before beginning its exit of the screen.
number.name: _TimeBeforeRetreat

number.desc: The y-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _YCentrePosition

text.desc: Show this text in the Intro Title. Leave blank to use the scene's name.
text.name: _AlternativeText

number.desc: The initial speed to slide off the screen at.
number.name: _SlideSpeed

boolean.desc: Should a rounded rectangle be drawn behind the text?
boolean.name: _DrawRectangle

number.desc: The x-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _XCentrePosition

color.desc: The fill colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
color.name: _FillColour

color.desc: The stroke colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn. (Stroke is the outline).
color.name: _StrokeColour

number.desc: The thickness, in pixels, of the stroke around the outside of the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _StrokeThickness

number.desc: Padding around the text, in pixels, for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _Padding

number.desc: The amount the rounded rectangle is rounded, if one is drawn. (Use 0 for right-angled corners).
number.name: _Rounding

text.desc: The direction the Intro Title slides away to.
text.name: _SlideDirection

number.desc: The slide speed is incremented by this value every update.
number.name: _SlideSpeedChange

snippet.desc: Make a button that opens an URL in the default web browser when clicked or touched.
snippet.description: Make a button that opens an URL in the default web browser when clicked or touched.
snippet.name: Open URL Button

text.desc:
The URL to open in the default webbrowser. The URL has to start with http:// followed by the web address.
This behavior only works if the SWF is hosted on a server or if you open the SWF in a browser (i.e. if the SWF is in a remote or localWithNetwork sandbox.)
text.name: _URL

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an pressed-down state.
animation.name: _PressedAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in an unpressed state.
animation.name: _NormalAnimation

animation.desc: Animation for the button in a focused state. Not used in mobile games.
animation.name: _HoverAnimation
